docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Friday, Sept. 5 -- The United States Ambassador, C. Burke Elbrick, was kidnapped yesterday at gunpoint on a street in Rio de Janeiro.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Friday, Sept. 5 -- The United States Ambassador, C. Burke Elbrick, was kidnapped yesterday at gunpoint on a street in Rio de Janeiro.
docs.abstract: Elbrick, C B (Amb): Kidnapped at gunpoint on Rio de Janeiro st; kidnappers reptdly leave behind manifesto threatening to kill him if their demands, outlined in manifesto, are not met within 48 hrs

headline.main: Gunmen Kidnap U.S. Envoy in Brazil; Elbrick Taken From His Car on Street in Rio by Two Guerrilla Bands Note Threatens His Life Unless Brazil Frees 15 Political Prisoners Gunmen in Brazil Kidnap U.S. Envoy; Death Warning Is Left

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 6 -- When Peru held Argentina's national World Cup team to a 2-2 draw last Sunday and thus eliminated it from the tournament, a sigh of relief went up all over the world of soccer.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 6 -- When Peru held Argentina's national World Cup team to a 2-2 draw last Sunday and thus eliminated it from the tournament, a sigh of relief went up all over the world of soccer.

headline.main: Argentina's Elimination Called Boon to World Soccer

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru -- Nearly two years ago, the celebrated Ernesto Che Guevara and his Cuban-led adventurers were killed in eastern Bolivia, to the enormous relief of Washington and most of the governments of Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru -- Nearly two years ago, the celebrated Ernesto Che Guevara and his Cuban-led adventurers were killed in eastern Bolivia, to the enormous relief of Washington and most of the governments of Latin America.

headline.main: Latin America; A Kidnapping Calls Attention Anew to the Active Guerrillas

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: BOSTON, Sept. 14 (UPI) -- Aristotle Onassis and his bride of one year, the former Jacqueline Kennedy, personally have spent between $15-million and $20-million since their marriage, The Boston Record American reported today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Sept. 14 (UPI) -- Aristotle Onassis and his bride of one year, the former Jacqueline Kennedy, personally have spent between $15-million and $20-million since their marriage, The Boston Record American reported today.

headline.main: Onassis' Costs for Year Are Put at $15-Million

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 21 -- Despite the arrest of hundreds of suspects and continous police raids on arms, caches and hideouts, guerrilla operations by Uruguay's Leftwing Tupamaro movement have become one of the most disquieting problems facing...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 21 -- Despite the arrest of hundreds of suspects and continous police raids on arms, caches and hideouts, guerrilla operations by Uruguay's Leftwing Tupamaro movement have become one of the most disquieting problems facing President Jorge Pacheco Areco.
docs.abstract: discussed as major problem confronting Pacheco Govt; their latest exploit, kidnapping of banker and newspaper publisher G Pellegrini Giampetro, detailed; continuing radio broadcasts, originating from clandestine transmitters, noted; strict press and radio censorship currently in effect seen indicative of extent of Govt's concern

headline.main: CITY GUERRILLAS WORRY URUGUAY; Kidnapping of a Montevideo Banker Is Latest Act

docs.snippet: ATLANTA, Oct. 2 -- Capt. Budge E. Williams coiled and uncoiled his seat belt as the jetliner flew over American soil. Scarcely more than a day before he had been in an Army stockade in Vietnam, charged with murder. Now he was going home.
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, Oct. 2 -- Capt. Budge E. Williams coiled and uncoiled his seat belt as the jetliner flew over American soil. Scarcely more than a day before he had been in an Army stockade in Vietnam, charged with murder. Now he was going home.
docs.abstract: Williams discusses his experiences; says he is 'dying to talk' but fears he would peril others in Vietnam; is unsure of his plans

headline.main: A Green Beret Is 'Dying to Talk' but Fears He Would Peril People in Vietnam

docs.snippet: Tupamaros battle police in sts of Pando, 20 mi E of Montevideo; rob 3 banks and seize police station; police rept 15 seized, 3 killed, 1 hurt; 1 police official injured
